item.title: Ticket #4706 ("You should update your .htaccess now." message appears even for ...) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: There's a patch. Now it uses the logic like from the bottom of options-permalink.php where it decides whether or not to echo out the .htaccess code.

item.title: 4706.001.diff attached to Ticket #4706
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Better logic

item.title: Ticket #4706 ("You should update your .htaccess now." message appears even for ...) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Setting permalink structure as: 

/index.php/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%postname%/

The following message is shown on update: 

You should update your .htaccess now.

No code for .htaccess is provided (because I've chosen a non-mod_rewrite structure).

item.description: Version, Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #4696 (Comment feeds need to be noindex by default) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #4554 (Canonical trailing slashes) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description: If the there was canonical urls for posts, pages and categories, then it would be a big step. Don't mind this issue being solved in multiple steps, and taking the easy ones first instead of trying to solve everything in one step.

item.title: Ticket #4704 (Invalid RSS2 Comments Feed) updated
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description: Ahh.. It just occurred to me that it might not be desirable to publish email addresses of comment authors, considering it says that you won't on the default theme page. So... forget the above patch, perhaps the dc:creator would indeed be a better way to go.

item.title: Ticket #4704 (Invalid RSS2 Comments Feed) updated
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description:
Keywords, Priority, Version, Milestone changed

Agreed, this causes all comment feeds to be invalid. The author element is supposed to conform to RFC822.

​http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/rss/rss.html#ltauthorgtSubelementOfLtitemgt ​http://feedvalidator.org/docs/error/InvalidContact.html

I'm attaching a patch to fix this for 2.2.2. Trunk patch coming soon.

item.title: Ticket #4705 (Import error from xml WP export file) created
item.dc:creator: alakhnor
item.description:
After an xml export from WP2.1.2, I tried to import into 2.3 and got this error message:

WordPress database error: [Table 'wordpress230.wp_categories' doesn't exist] SELECT cat_name FROM wp_categories

Catchable fatal error: Object of class stdClass could not be converted to string in C:\wamp\www\wordpress230\wp-includes\taxonomy.php on line 647

item.title: Ticket #4704 (Invalid RSS2 Comments Feed) created
item.dc:creator: lexhair
item.description:
Version 2.2.2. My comments RSS2 feed was invalid because the author tags did not enclose a valid email address.

I modified the feed-rss2-comments.php file to include xlmns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" in the head space and changed the author tags to dc:creator tags. This validated the comments feed.

I apologize for not submitting the patch as a diff but I'm quite a noob when it comes to this stuff.

item.title: walker-classes.diff attached to Ticket #4703
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description: Adds classes for page and category items

item.title: Ticket #4703 (Add classes to the Page and Category Walkers) created
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description:
Walker_Page needs an ID specific class to allow users to customize the look of links produced by it based on the specific page being linked to. Several users have requested such a thing on the support forums, and the only way to do it is by hacking the core code: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/104396

Similarly, the Walker_Category could use some better classes, such as a general cat_item class as well as a cat_item_ID class.

Patch attched to do both of these.

item.title: Ticket #4702 (Fatal error when making child category) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Owner changed

There's my swing at it... but I don't know if the error is that these functions don't accept term objects as well as ints or if the error is that these functions are being passed parent term objects. I opted for the more liberal case and accepted either. Would like to get Ryan's feedback on this one as this is his code.

item.title: 4702.001.diff attached to Ticket #4702
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Accept $parent as object or int

item.title: Ticket #4702 (Fatal error when making child category) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
I get: 

Catchable fatal error: Object of class stdClass could not be converted to string in [...]/wp-includes/taxonomy.php on line 647

Both lines are $wpdb->query() calls.

item.title: Ticket #4230 (Change update-links to be wp-cron compatible) updated
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description:
Sounds good. Word of warning to the testers: I've never gotten the pingomatic call to actually work. I think this is a problem with pingomatic. But, since this is the current code, it's what I used for this patch.

The patch in ticket #4231 also has this code change, but also changes the update_links code to use RSS feeds to get the last updated time instead. That code actually works because it doesn't rely on pingomatic.

item.title: Ticket #4702 (Fatal error when making child category) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description: PHP v5.2.1, MySQL v5.0.37

item.title: Ticket #4702 (Fatal error when making child category) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Go to Manage -> Categories and try to make a new category that's the child of another category. Doing so will produce the following error: 

Catchable fatal error: Object of class stdClass could not be converted to string in [...]\wp-includes\taxonomy.php on line 765

Editing a category and turning it into the child of another also causes this issue.

Props to Ryan Fitzer for finding the issue.

item.title: Ticket #4230 (Change update-links to be wp-cron compatible) updated
item.dc:creator: Otto42
item.description: Delete it altogether. The only reason to have it separate is so it can be executed separately as a cron job. With wp-cron doing it, there's no reason to have it at all. And with the function being pluggable, plugins can replace it if they like.

item.title: Ticket #4701 (ID attribute for adminmenu items) updated
item.dc:creator: leonid
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: menu-header.php.diff attached to Ticket #4701
item.dc:creator: leonid
item.description: Patch wp-admin/menu-header.php to have ID attributes for admin menu

item.title: Ticket #4701 (ID attribute for adminmenu items) created
item.dc:creator: leonid
item.description:
Administration menu customizations are very limited right now (think: icons for menu items), partially due to the fact that menu items don't have ID attributes. The attached patch (against trunk r5844) generates ID attributes using sanitize_title(). The resulting values look like "adminmenu_dashboard" and "submenu_write-post".

There was a preliminary OK for this functionality from Matt on wp-hackers list: ​http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-hackers/2007-July/013746.html

item.title: Ticket #2004 (Pages page should page) updated
item.dc:creator: leonid
item.description: There is a Search Pages plugin which seems to work just fine for searching, not paging though. ​http://www.internetofficer.com/wordpress/search-pages/

item.title: Ticket #4554 (Canonical trailing slashes) updated
item.dc:creator: snakefoot
item.description:
Instead of just validating that the URL is using the correct format, then it would be nice if it validated that the url was the official permalink:

​http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/permalink-validator/
